thread.title: City Bank to Give Away $60,000 to Nonprofits
thread.title_full: City Bank to Give Away $60,000 to Nonprofits - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: City Bank to Give Away $60,000 to Nonprofits
text:
City Bank
LUBBOCK, Texas , Oct. 21, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- City Bank will kickoff its eighth annual Community Rewards with a reception October 22 at 5:30 p.m. at the Griffith Center (located on the lower floor of the City Bank Main Branch at 5219 City Bank Parkway) where it will announce exciting changes to this year's program, expanding both the money available to local nonprofit agencies and the number of agencies that will share in those "Rewards."
Changes to this year's program include increasing the total amount rewarded from $50,000 to $60,000 and the number of winners from 10 to 18. Six $500 "Early Rewards" will also be presented at this year's kickoff reception.
"What we do is a tiny drop in the bucket to the incredible and never-ending services provided by these agencies, their staffs and volunteers," said City Bank President and CEO Cory T. Newsom . "The demands on these nonprofits grow every year and we are excited to grow our program as well to help better meet the needs of these difference-makers in some small way."
Lubbock -area residents* will determine this year's winners by voting at citybankonline.com daily for their favorite charity from November 1 - December 13 . Votes will be tallied in each of six categories (Basic Human Needs, Health & Wellness, Child Development & Advocacy, Education & Youth Services, Community Development & Leadership, and Animal Welfare & Environment) and first-, second- and third-place winners within each category will be awarded $5,000 , $2,500 and $1,000 respectively. The top overall vote-getter will receive an additional $5,000 . Registration deadline is Wednesday, Oct. 28 . Winners will be announced the week before Christmas.
"We're proud to continue our goal of assisting area nonprofits in carrying out their missions of hope and service to those in need," said City Bank President and CEO Cory T. Newsom."
In its first seven years, Community Rewards has contributed $360,000 to 65 different nonprofits.
Questions may be directed to Norval Pollard at npollard@citybanktexas.com or 806-792-7101, ext. 3903.
*Community Rewards rules state voters must be at least 18 years of age and one vote per email address per day will be counted. Voting will be updated regularly and the top 5 in each category will be listed at citybankonline.com .
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151016/277714
To view the original version on PR Newswire, visit: http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/city-bank-to-give-away-60000-to-nonprofits-300161297.html
